detaileddescription.para:
Handle the drawing related tasks of the text areas
ta
pointer to an object
mask
the object will be drawn only in this area
mode
LV_DESIGN_COVER_CHK: only check if the object fully covers the 'mask_p' area (return 'true' if yes) LV_DESIGN_DRAW_MAIN: draw the object (always return 'true') LV_DESIGN_DRAW_POST: drawing after every children are drawn
return
true/false, depends on 'mode'

An extended scrollable design of the page. Calls the normal design function and draws a cursor.
scrl
pointer to the scrollable part of the Text area
mask
the object will be drawn only in this area
mode
LV_DESIGN_COVER_CHK: only check if the object fully covers the 'mask_p' area (return 'true' if yes) LV_DESIGN_DRAW_MAIN: draw the object (always return 'true') LV_DESIGN_DRAW_POST: drawing after every children are drawn
return true/false, depends on 'mode'

Signal function of the text area
ta
pointer to a text area object
sign
a signal type from lv_signal_t enum
param
pointer to a signal specific variable
LV_RES_OK: the object is not deleted in the function; LV_RES_INV: the object is deleted

Signal function of the scrollable part of the text area
scrl
pointer to scrollable part of a text area object
sign
a signal type from lv_signal_t enum
param
pointer to a signal specific variable
LV_RES_OK: the object is not deleted in the function; LV_RES_INV: the object is deleted

Called to blink the cursor
ta
pointer to a text area
hide
1: hide the cursor, 0: show it

Dummy function to animate char hiding in pwd mode. Does nothing, but a function is required in car hiding anim. (pwd_char_hider callback do the real job)
ta
unused
x
unused

Call when an animation is ready to convert all characters to '*'
a
pointer to the animation

Hide all characters (convert them to '*')
ta
pointer to text area object

Test an unicode character if it is accepted or not. Checks max length and accepted char list.
ta
pointer to a test area object
c
an unicode character
true: accapted; false: rejected

Create a text area objects
par
pointer to an object, it will be the parent of the new text area
copy
pointer to a text area object, if not NULL then the new object will be copied from it
pointer to the created text area

Insert a character to the current cursor position. To add a wide char, e.g. 'Á' use `lv_txt_encoded_conv_wc('Á')`
ta
pointer to a text area object
c
a character (e.g. 'a')

Insert a text to the current cursor position
ta
pointer to a text area object
txt
a '\0' terminated string to insert

Delete a the left character from the current cursor position
ta
pointer to a text area object

Delete the right character from the current cursor position
ta
pointer to a text area object

Set the text of a text area
ta
pointer to a text area
txt
pointer to the text

Set the placeholder text of a text area
ta
pointer to a text area
txt
pointer to the text

Set the cursor position
obj
pointer to a text area object
pos
the new cursor position in character index < 0 : index from the end of the text LV_TA_CURSOR_LAST: go after the last character

Set the cursor type.
ta
pointer to a text area object
cur_type
element of 'lv_ta_cursor_type_t'

Enable/Disable the positioning of the the cursor by clicking the text on the text area.
ta
pointer to a text area object
en
true: enable click positions; false: disable

Enable/Disable password mode
ta
pointer to a text area object
en
true: enable, false: disable

Configure the text area to one line or back to normal
ta
pointer to a Text area object
en
true: one line, false: normal

Set the alignment of the text area. In one line mode the text can be scrolled only with LV_LABEL_ALIGN_LEFT. This function should be called if the size of text area changes.
ta
pointer to a text are object
align
the desired alignment from lv_label_align_t. (LV_LABEL_ALIGN_LEFT/CENTER/RIGHT)

Set a list of characters. Only these characters will be accepted by the text area
ta
pointer to Text Area
list
list of characters. Only the pointer is saved. E.g. "+-.,0123456789"

Set max length of a Text Area.
ta
pointer to Text Area
num
the maximal number of characters can be added (lv_ta_set_text ignores it)

In LV_EVENT_INSERT the text which planned to be inserted can be replaced by an other text. It can be used to add automatic formatting to the text area.
ta
pointer to a text area.
txt
pointer to a new string to insert. If "" no text will be added. The variable must be live after the event_cb exists. (Should be global or static)

Set a style of a text area
ta
pointer to a text area object
type
which style should be set
style
pointer to a style

Enable/disable selection mode.
ta
pointer to a text area object
en
true or false to enable/disable selection mode

Set how long show the password before changing it to '*'
ta
pointer to Text area
time
show time in milliseconds. 0: hide immediately.

Set cursor blink animation time
ta
pointer to Text area
time
blink period. 0: disable blinking

Get the text of a text area. In password mode it gives the real text (not '*'s).
ta
pointer to a text area object
pointer to the text

Get the placeholder text of a text area
ta
pointer to a text area object
pointer to the text

Get the label of a text area
ta
pointer to a text area object
pointer to the label object

Get the current cursor position in character index
ta
pointer to a text area object
the cursor position

Get the current cursor type.
ta
pointer to a text area object
element of 'lv_ta_cursor_type_t'

Get whether the cursor click positioning is enabled or not.
ta
pointer to a text area object
true: enable click positions; false: disable

Get the password mode attribute
ta
pointer to a text area object
true: password mode is enabled, false: disabled

Get the one line configuration attribute
ta
pointer to a text area object
true: one line configuration is enabled, false: disabled

Get a list of accepted characters.
ta
pointer to Text Area
list of accented characters.

Set max length of a Text Area.
ta
pointer to Text Area
the maximal number of characters to be add

Get a style of a text area
ta
pointer to a text area object
type
which style should be get
style pointer to a style

Find whether text is selected or not.
ta
Text area object
whether text is selected or not

Find whether selection mode is enabled.
ta
pointer to a text area object
true: selection mode is enabled, false: disabled

Set how long show the password before changing it to '*'
ta
pointer to Text area
show time in milliseconds. 0: hide immediately.

Set cursor blink animation time
ta
pointer to Text area
time blink period. 0: disable blinking

Clear the selection on the text area.
ta
Text area object

Move the cursor one character right
ta
pointer to a text area object

Move the cursor one character left
ta
pointer to a text area object

Move the cursor one line down
ta
pointer to a text area object

Move the cursor one line up
ta
pointer to a text area object
